intro: Leucoseris, commonly known as the white dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species that are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are characterized by their basal rosettes of narrow, lance-shaped leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Leucoseris species are often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. They are known for their ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
